    All Classes and Interfaces

    Class
    Description
    Application
    The Application class represents the main entry point for the application.
    AvgCommand
    The AvgCommand class implements the Command interface and is responsible for calculating the average of CalculationData items in a ViewResult.
    CalculationData
    The CalculationData class stores a number and its representations in different numeral systems: binary, octal, and hexadecimal.
    Calculator
    The Calculator class performs numerical conversions and allows for serialization and deserialization of CalculationData objects.
    ChangeConsoleCommand
    The ChangeConsoleCommand class extends ChangeItemCommand and implements the ConsoleCommand interface.
    ChangeItemCommand
    The ChangeItemCommand class implements the Command interface and represents a command that modifies a CalculationData object by setting its number to a new randomly generated value within a specified range (10 to 1000).
    Command
    The Command interface represents an executable action.
    CommandQueue
    The CommandQueue class implements the Queue interface and provides a thread-safe implementation for storing and processing Command objects.
    ConsoleCommand
    The ConsoleCommand interface extends the Command interface and represents a command that can be executed via the console.
    Dialog
    The Dialog class provides a user interface to interact with the View object.
    ExecuteConsoleCommand
    The ExecuteConsoleCommand class implements the ConsoleCommand interface and represents a command that executes a series of tasks involving multiple threads.
    GenerateConsoleCommand
    The GenerateConsoleCommand class implements the ConsoleCommand interface and represents a console command for generating and displaying random data.
    Main
    The Main class represents the entry point of the application, where the program's menu is initialized and commands are registered to be executed by the user.
    MaxCommand
    The MaxCommand class implements the Command interface and is responsible for finding the maximum CalculationData item from the list of items in a ViewResult.
    Menu
    The Menu class implements the Command interface and represents a console menu that allows the user to interact with various ConsoleCommand objects.
    MinMaxCommand
    The MinMaxCommand class implements the Command interface and is responsible for finding both the minimum and maximum CalculationData items from the list of items in a ViewResult.
    Queue
    The Queue interface defines the contract for a queue that can store and retrieve Command objects.
    RestoreConsoleCommand
    The RestoreConsoleCommand class implements the ConsoleCommand interface and represents a console command for restoring previously saved data.
    SaveConsoleCommand
    The SaveConsoleCommand class implements the ConsoleCommand interface and represents a console command for saving the current data.
    TestMain
    Unit tests for the AvgCommand, MaxCommand, MinMaxCommand, and ExecuteConsoleCommand.
    View
    The View interface defines the methods that must be implemented by any class responsible for displaying and interacting with the view of the application.
    Viewable
    The Viewable interface defines the contract for any class that provides a view.
    ViewableResult
    The ViewableResult class implements the Viewable interface and provides an implementation for the getView method, which returns a ViewResult object.
    ViewableTable
    The ViewableTable class extends ViewableResult and provides a method to retrieve a ViewTable instance.
    ViewConsoleCommand
    The ViewConsoleCommand class implements the ConsoleCommand interface and represents a console command for displaying the current data.
    ViewResult
    The ViewResult class implements the View interface and provides functionality for initializing, calculating, saving, restoring, and displaying numerical conversion results.
    ViewTable
    The ViewTable class extends ViewResult and provides functionality to display the results of calculations in a table format.
